subject: Re: [junit] I need some preconditions to be set on my Test  class

Nothing stops you from doing exactly what you suggested in the code sample below.

Add the request and response as parameters to your TestCase constructor, then build the TestSuite by hand. In your TestCase constructor, just call "super(name);".

Why don't you want to pass the request and response as parameters?

So said Sridhar Visvanath ( Cognizant) on 4/7/2003 --------------------
Hi, 
I have a class SampleCase that I need to test using a test class TestSampleCase. 

Now I have around 25 methods in Samplecase and for all of them, I have corresponding test methods in TestSampleCase. 

I have a suite() method in TestSampleCase wherein I will pass the TestSampleCase.class object as follows

public Test suite() {
            TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(TestSampleCase.class);
            return suite;
      }      

This works fine. Now if my TestSampleCase is invoked by an external servlet, (I have handled the running of a test suite, by iterating through the tests). Things work fine.

However, if I need to pass some parameter to the constructor of TestSuite() , say the request and response objects. In that case, I do not know how to test the suite. 

I have to do something like this

TestSampleCase tsc = new TestSampleCase(request, response);
new TestSuite().addTest(tsc); 

I want to run all the 25 test methods without passing them as parameters. How do I go about this. 

PFA, the files for your perusal.

warm regards
Sridhar Visvanath
***********************************************************
I don't say what u wanna hear, I say the truth
